newsitem.title: POLAND: Warsaw bourse to calculate index for NFIs.
newsitem.headline: Warsaw bourse to calculate index for NFIs.

text.p: The Warsaw Stock Exchange (WSE) will calculate a new price index for National Investment Funds, along with the funds' bourse debut on June 12, a deputy president of the exchange said on Friday.
Ryszard Czerniawski told a news conference the index, to be called NIF, will be calculated as a sum of all NFIs prices.
Under Poland's mass privatisation programme, 15 NFIs were given controling stakes in more than 500 medium-size companies.
Each fund, run by international managers, was given a leading, 33 percent stake in more than 30 companies and small equity stakes in the remaining firms.
From May 12, the 26 million Poles who bought participation units in the scheme have been entitled to exchange them for 15 shares, one in each fund.
